job_title: Licensed Massage Therapist in Porterville, CA

job_title: Medical Coding Specialist I in Exeter, CA
pros: Our coding team worked great together,  benefits,  PTO, family orientated, understanding Directors / Management , room for growth and the pay was a plus.
cons: The "Clicks" within not only department but hospital wide as well , the prices in the Café where increased. Documentation by physicians and nursing could use some dressing up on the proper way to document.

pros: Can't really think of any (Compared to OTHER hospitals)
cons: Cut throat staff. LOTS of back-stabbing. WEAK management.... manages with fear rather than encouragement. "Look around people, half of you WON'T be here within a year"..... VERY non-supportive of staff. When presented with problems between staff department manager tells you to "Work it out, that's not my concern" !!!!!!! Benefits are no better than standard. Hospital USED to pay employees medical insurance 100& but no longer the case. I would NOT recommend this place for employment at all !!
very political - not supportive when it comes down to it

pros: Great benefits, good pay. Wonderful meals in the cafeteria.
cons: Upper management pays no attention to employee needs. Absolutely no compromises when it comes to work environment changes that would benefit the staff.
